author: Amazon Customer

review: Remote control not intuitive enough. It would be nice to have an ON/OFF power button on the remote or the unit. this is one feature that no one should look for on any electric device and must be done in one click of a button. The voice activation feature works well but unfortunately not smart to to turn off my TV when I ask, instead shows a list of movie or other things that contains the words "Sleep, Turn Of TV etc." depending on the phrase I use to have my TV turn off. I finally realize that I have to press the home button and select  to put Fire TV to sleep, but the te fire TV comes back on. How do you turn this thing off?
author: zadi

review: Love it.  Was using PS3 to view Netflix.  Bought this and side loaded XBMC.  Now the family uses amazon prime (easy to navigate)  I use Kodi.  I like the small size and the low energy consumption. The last update added a forced sleep mode which is nice, but I would have still preferred an On/Off switch.  Our large screen TV is an older model with only one HDMI port.  I use a three way HDMI switch to accommodate external boxes.  I have to manually switch away from the Fire TV box because the sleep mode is detected as still on.  Also, my house has a wired network so there is zero streaming issues with the NIC connection.  Great little box
